newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mitsubishi says no plan to quit pinball business.
newsitem.headline: Mitsubishi says no plan to quit pinball business.

text.p: Mitsubishi Corp said on Thursday that it had no plan to withdraw from the business of prepaid cards for "pachinko" pinball machines.
A Mitsubishi spokesman said the trading house had no plan to sell its stake in Japan Leisure Card System Co, which issues prepaid cards for pachinko pinball machines.
The card company is 18.85 percent owned by Mitsubishi and 10.05 percent owned by NTT Data Corp.
"We have no plan to withdraw from the business. We will support the card company with NTT Data," the Mitsubishi spokesman said.
The spokesman also said, however, that it was unclear whether the unit, which is saddled with debts and accumulated losses, could post profits in the year to March 31, 1997.
The Mitsubishi spokesman said the card unit"s liabilities exceeded its assets by 46 billion yen at the end of September 1996.
He said the unit has been facing difficulties due to widespread card forgery but the financial impact from the forged cards was now sharply decreasing.
"We hear that losses from forged cards are dramatically decreasing but we don"t know if the unit can post profits in this fiscal year because it has accumulated losses," he said.

The Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shinbun said on Thursday that the unit was expected to post a net loss in 1996/97, despite an estimated record nine trillion yen or more in sales. The paper did not specify the amount of the estimated net loss.
